definition.title: What is an Authority Hook?
definition.content: An Authority Hook is a specialized positioning statement that instantly communicates your value. Unlike a generic bio, it uses the 6 W's framework to answer the listener's subconscious question: 'Why should I listen to you?'

tips: Be specific about WHO - 'busy entrepreneurs' beats 'business owners'
Focus on tangible RESULTS, not just activities
Make your HOW unique - this is your differentiator
Test your hook by saying it out loud - it should flow naturally

faq.question: What are the 6 W's?
faq.answer: WHO (who you help), WHAT (results you deliver), WHEN (in what situations), HOW (your unique method), WHERE (context), and WHY (why it matters).

faq.question: How specific should I be?
faq.answer: Very specific. 'Busy entrepreneurs' is better than 'business owners.' 'First 3 years' is better than 'when starting out.'

faq.question: Can I use this in my bio?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Your authority hook is the foundation of your bio, tagline, and all positioning content.

faq.question: Is this really free?
faq.answer: Yes, you can generate up to 3 hooks per day completely free without signing up.
